- Improved streaming performance

# MCP Server Configuration Locations

Based on the documentation, MCP servers can be configured at different scope levels with specific file paths:

## User-Level Configuration
For user scope (available across all projects), servers are stored in `~/.claude.json`. This file persists on your machine and remains private to your account.

## Project-Level Configuration
Project-scoped servers use a `.mcp.json` file at your project root, designed to be checked into version control so team members access identical tools.

## Local Configuration
Local-scoped servers (the default) are also stored in `~/.claude.json` but organized under your project's path, remaining private to that specific project directory.

## Configuration Format
The standard structure follows this pattern:

```json
{
  "mcpServers": {
    "server-name": {
      "type": "http|stdio|sse",
      "url": "https://...",
      "command": "...",
      "args": [],
      "env": {}
    }
  }
}
```

The documentation emphasizes that "environment variables can be expanded in command, args, env, url, and headers" using syntax like `${VAR}` or `${VAR:-default}`.
